channel.title: Homes on Pierce Donovan
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Pierce Donovan

item.description: About Me I’m an environmental economist that enjoys applying ideas from ecology, mathematics, and physics in my research. Most of my work focuses on the structural modeling of bioeconomic systems. I currently contribute to research for the Glen Canyon Adaptive Management Program at the U.S. Geological Survey. My aim is to help direct fieldwork in order to more efficiently manage the Colorado River ecosystem. In the Fall semester, I teach Introduction to Econometrics (ECON 441).
